In place of a solid slug the weapon fires a cluster of small projectiles across a spread pattern. Shot may only be fired from smooth-bore weapons, and is considered the default round for shotguns. Like @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#shotguns]{Shotguns} the shot grants a +2 bonus to hit any target within Close range, but −2 at Long range. Shot becomes practical at Tech 14, and remains popular far beyond that.

Use @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.VKOd8ozOhfGvbfPn]{Shots Rechargements}.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Shots Rechargements.name: Shots Rechargements
Shots Rechargements.description: In place of a solid slug the weapon fires a cluster of small projectiles across a spread pattern. Shot may only be fired from smooth-bore weapons, and is considered the default round for shotguns. Like @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#shotguns]{Shotguns} the shot grants a +2 bonus to hit any target within Close range, but −2 at Long range. Shot becomes practical at Tech 14, and remains popular far beyond that.

Shrapnel Shells Rechargements.name: Shrapnel Shells Rechargements
Shrapnel Shells Rechargements.description:
Only for @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#heavy-weapons-and-explosives]{Heavy Weapons}

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#explosives-and-area-effect-attacks]{Zone d'effet}

Sometimes called scattershot or fragmentation rounds. Lower Tech versions used fuses, while Tech 23 and beyond use sensors to detonate at the right altitude, showering high-speed shell fragments or flechettes across the Zone d'effet area. Damage drops –2, reducing effectiveness against armored targets, but the weapon gains a Medium Zone d'effet area of effect.

Silencer.name: Silencer
Silencer.description:
A silencer is a tube or baffle added to the barrel of a weapon that suppresses the amount of noise it makes when fired. This lowers the damage value of the firearm by two, but reduces the sound of most weapons by enough that firing doesn’t automatically give away a hidden character’s position. Silenced weapons can only be fired out to Medium range.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Situational Awareness.name: Conscience environnementale
Situational Awareness.description:
Les Chevaliers des tempêtes aguerris sont hyper conscients de leur environnement quand le danger menace. Ils notent les sorties possibles, perçoivent les intentions de leurs adversaires et savent quand et comment il convient d’agir.

Une fois par scène, un personnage avec Conscience environnementale peut poser une seule carte directement de sa main dans sa Réserve (et l’utiliser immédiatement s’il le souhaite).

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Size (Dwarf).name: Size (Dwarf)
Size (Dwarf).description: Dwarves cannot wear armor or clothing designed for normal humans or elves - it must be tailored to their squat form.

Slap Patch.name: Slap Patch
Slap Patch.description:
A strip of vat-grown skin that fuses with damaged flesh it comes in contact with. Using an action and a slap patch immediately heals 1 wound.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Slaver Collar.name: Slaver Collar
Slaver Collar.description:
Attaching a slaver collar requires several minutes, and is linked to a master device. If the wearer moves more than 500 meters away, the master device stops transmitting, or the master dies, the collar detonates dealing [[/r 2d6x6max5+24]]{24 +2 BD} damage. The collar is placed underneath any worn armor, ignoring it.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Slayer's Bandoleer.name: Cartouchière du tueur
Slayer's Bandoleer.description:
Acquis par le talent by @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.iKjiXUHRWLiyQY3S]{Armurier ★}

les chasseurs de monstres sont équipés d’une cartouchière spéciale conçue pour contenir 18 cartouches (12 normales et 6 balles spécialisées).

Indiquer ici quelles munitions sont utilisées.

Sling.name: Fronde
Sling.description:
Une fronde est constituée de lanières de cuir ou de cordes avec une sorte de poche au milieu. Une pierre ou une bille de métal est mise dans la poche puis en prenant les lanières on la fait tournoyer rapidement avant de lâcher une des lanières projetant ainsi le projectile sur une cible.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description:
Slow decreases a living being’s speed and makes it more difficult for him to do multiple things at once. The caster points at his target in slow motion.

The target’s Speed is decreased by 25% and the target is Stymied. Speed refers to the target’s personal walking, running, climbing, swimming, or flying speed. Slow doesn’t affect machines or devices of any type.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Slow.good: Speed is decreased by 50% and the target may not run
Slow.outstanding: Speed is decreased by 75% and the target loses his next turn (he might get another via a Flurry or similar ability, however)

Small Shield.name: Petit bouclier
Small Shield.description:
Il est constitué généralement d’une simple pièce ronde en bois fixée à l’avant-bras par des lanières.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Smart Ammo.name: Smart Ammo
Smart Ammo.description:
First available at Tech 25, smart ammunition is not really a bullet but a small, selfguiding missile. The projectile is equipped with a sensor, usually a heat-seeker, and can change its trajectory during flight to track a target. A target must still be visible—the missile doesn’t make sharp turns around corners and the like.

Smart ammunition makes the test for the attack  @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#favored-skills]{Favored}. Requires a Smartgun Attachment weapon add-on or the CSI EyeKill Mk. IV to use.

Use @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.Wn0qrUh8fMD79xZV]{Smart Ammo Rechargements}.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Smart Ammo Rechargements.name: Smart Ammo Rechargements
Smart Ammo Rechargements.description:
Aquired by @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.qEbyBsLTvxVqiZ29]{Smart Ammo}

First available at Tech 25, smart ammunition is not really a bullet but a small, selfguiding missile. The projectile is equipped with a sensor, usually a heat-seeker, and can change its trajectory during flight to track a target. A target must still be visible—the missile doesn’t make sharp turns around corners and the like.

Smart ammunition makes the test for the attack @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#favored-skills]{Favored}. Requires a Smartgun Attachment weapon add-on or the CSI EyeKill Mk. IV to use.

Smartgun Attachment.name: Smartgun Attachment
Smartgun Attachment.description:
Has no effect on its own other than to allow the use of @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.qEbyBsLTvxVqiZ29]{Smart Ammo} with the weapon. The attachment records footage of the weapon’s targets, and a connected cyber eye (see @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#cyberware]{Cyberware}) also sees through the weapon’s sensors.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Smiling Deceiver.name: Charmant imposteur ★
Smiling Deceiver.description:
Le personnage sait dissimuler son Aspect effrayant derrière un faux sourire et des platitudes. Ses tests de Persuasion, Débrouillardise et Provocation sont Favorisés. Cependant, s’il rate l’un de ces tests (y compris des tests en opposition), son Aspect effrayant est immédiatement révélé à tous ceux qui peuvent le voir. Les bonus de cet Atout sont alors perdus pour le reste de la scène.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Smoke Pellets.name: Smoke Pellets
Smoke Pellets.description:
Can be thrown to the ground as a trick interaction, and leaves behind smoke (−2 Concealment penalty) in a five-meter radius.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Smoke Shells Rechargements.name: Smoke Shells Rechargements
Smoke Shells Rechargements.description:
Only for @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#heavy-weapons-and-explosives]{Heavy Weapons}

Common for target marking. The shells deal no damage, but instead cover a 10 meter radius with thick, colored smoke (−2 Visibility). The smoke lingers in the area until the firer receives a Setback.

Sniper.name: Sniper
Sniper.description:
When the character uses @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#aim]{Aim} on a single ranged attack against a single foe, she adds an extra BD to the damage. This stacks with the usual bonus damage from Good and Outstanding results.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Sniper.prerequisites: At least 3 adds in energy weapons, fire combat, or missile weapons

Soothe.name: Soothe
Soothe.description:
Soothe sends out a refreshing wave of energy to the invoker and allies in range. Those affected instantly recover 2 Shock.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Soul Implement.name: Soul Implement
Soul Implement.description:
Wizards and magicians of all sorts frequently use implements such as wands or to enhance their spellcasting (see Aysle Sourcebook). Selecting this Perk grants the wizard one of the appropriate implements as shown below.

No matter the implement, the magician chooses one of the magic skills, and tests using that skill are Favored. This skill cannot be changed.

These implements have the same power as Arcane items, but since those require a significantly higher Magic Axiom than Core Earth has ever had, soul implements utilize the Law of Aegis to function by putting a piece of the user’s soul into it. Thus the use of soul implements is contradictory outside of Core Earth.

Should the item be destroyed or permanently lost, the wizard suffers a temporary Injury (see @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#defeat]{Defeat}). The wizard gains a new implement after one full act passes, which heals the Injury.

Alternatively, if the wizard has selected one of the following Perks, they can instead gain the listed implement:

  • Spellcaster: These wands are made by the magician, whittling branches from particular hardwood trees such as oak, maple, or poplar trees.
  • Geomancer (Selenite Crystal): These crystals are handpicked by geomancers who make a pilgrimage to the Cave of Crystals.
  • Mythomancer: Mythomancers use a variety of instruments (literally in the case of those who base their spellcasting on song) to enhance their spells. The physical form that this takes is not important, whether it be analog or digital, paper or silicon. What is important is that the spellcaster compiles the stories, songs, poems, plays, or movies themselves. The repertoire says something profound about the mythomancer’s soul, and whether the media is stored on a paper page, on a DVD, or MP3 player, the device functions through the Law of Aegis.

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
To cast this loathsome spell, the occultist manipulates the corpse’s jaws while beseeching the spirit that once resided inside to speak. The spirit retains its former consciousness–it knows it’s dead, may refuse to speak, is subject to persuasion, etc.

A particular corpse may only be questioned once per scene.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Speak with Dead.good: The corpse may only speak the truth, but may still refuse to answer
Speak with Dead.outstanding: The corpse must answer any questions truthfully, to the best of its knowledge

nnvZK3dO5NDXmVQQ.name: Lance primitive
nnvZK3dO5NDXmVQQ.description:
Pour l'utilisation en Arme de mêlée, voir @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.1iO7eayw5e5oZ7NF]{Lance primitive}

Long manche en bois avec une tête métallique, une lance peut être utilisée en mêlée ou être lancée comme une arme de jet. Il n’est pas rare que des guerriers qui les utilisent en transportent plusieurs. Ils en lancent certaines et en gardent au moins une pour le combat rapproché.

1iO7eayw5e5oZ7NF.name: Lance primitive
1iO7eayw5e5oZ7NF.description:
Pour l'utilisation en Arme de jet, voir @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.nnvZK3dO5NDXmVQQ]{Lance primitive}

Long manche en bois avec une tête métallique, une lance peut être utilisée en mêlée ou être lancée comme une arme de jet. Il n’est pas rare que des guerriers qui les utilisent en transportent plusieurs. Ils en lancent certaines et en gardent au moins une pour le combat rapproché.

Speed Demon.name: Bête de course
Speed Demon.description:
La moto est le mode de transport préféré de la plupart des Samouraïs électriques à cause de sa vitesse, de sa manœuvrabilité et surtout parce qu’aucun carénage ne limite l’utilisation de leur épée. Quand une Bête de course effectue une attaque de mêlée à partir d’une moto (ou de tout autre engin en mouvement qui permet d’attaquer librement, comme à bord d’un véhicule sans toit) il bénéficie d’un bonus de +2 aux dommages.

 

@UUID[Compendium.te016-pan-pacifica.pan-pacifica-items.Item.nnZDprTjdi14HA3Q]{Mise à jour} Présent dans Pan-Pacifica Sourcebook Module
Speed Demon.prerequisites: Au moins 2 rangs dans Véhicules terrestres.

Spell Slinger.name: Spell Slinger
Spell Slinger.description: When armed with a rod, wand, or a staff you may use Dexterity + apportation as a defense in place of dodge or melee weapons.

Spellcaster.name: Spellcaster
Spellcaster.description:
Cosms: Aysle, Core Earth, Cyberpapacy, Nile Empire, Orrorsh, Tharkold

Those who delve into the arcane arts go by many names — mage, wizard, witch, or warlock to name a few. Regardless of their particular background, all can cast spells using any of the four primary types of magical skill — alteration, apportation, conjuration, or divination magic.

When this Perk is taken, the mage may choose any three spells from her cosm’s @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.PjteC3KQ7SI4gobV#available-spells]{Spell List} for which she meets the minimum skill.

The Core Earth Magic supplement provide some expanded @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.VuPeUtSmf98Gws42.JournalEntryPage.aWRVocNcmjkxV1tL#available-spells]{Spell Lists}.

Spell details are explained in @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.PjteC3KQ7SI4gobV]{Magic}.

New Spells: This Perk may be taken more than once. Each time after the first, the character learns one additional spell.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Spellcaster.prerequisites: At least one add in alteration, apportation, conjuration, or divination

Spellproofed Armor.name: Spellproofed Armor
Spellproofed Armor.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#fatigue-:]{Fatigue}

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#integrale/torse-:]{Intégrale/Torse}

This ornate plate mail has potent wards. Any spell that targets the wearer or includes him as a target suffers a -4 penalty.
Spellproofed Armor.notes: Fatigues, Full Body, spells targeting the wearer suffers -4

Spiked Plates.name: Armure herse
Spiked Plates.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#fatigue-:]{Fatigue}

un enchevêtrement de plaques métalliques garnies de pointes et de lames protubérantes. Les pointes ajoutent le bonus d’armure aux dégâts des tests de Combat à mains nues en cas de @Compendium[te001-core-rulebook.regles.1EuTSTDatoZxt8fM]{Lutte}.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Spiked Plates.notes: Fatigue, Bonus ajoute aux combats à mains nues.

Spirit Bane.name: Spirit Bane
Spirit Bane.description:
Cosms: Core Earth, Aysle, Cyberpapacy, Living Land, Nile Empire, Orrorsh

The Storm Knight gains the ability to affect beings with the Ethereal Special Ability, such as ghosts, with unarmed combat or melee weapons.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Spirit Bane.prerequisites: At least one add in faith

Spirit Nemesis.name: Spirit Nemesis
Spirit Nemesis.description: Many spirits adopt a nonchalant attitude when inflicting pain or trying to kill corporeal beings, believing their victims are powerless to resist. Unfortunately for them, when facing someone with this Perk, spirits quickly find they are terribly mistaken. The hero’s physical attacks against ethereal creatures are Favored, and 1s on bonus dice are re-rolled (though the second roll stands).

Stab Vest.name: Gilet de protection
Stab Vest.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#integrale/torse-:]{Torse}

Plus léger et plus confortable qu’une veste balistique, cette armure est prévue pour arrêter des attaques tranchantes ou perforantes. Elle demeure tout de même relativement efficace contre les balles.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Staff.name: Bâton
Staff.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#deux-mains-:]{Deux Mains}

Un bâton peut être une arme très efficace entre des mains expertes. Un bâton peut être utilisé comme bâton de marche et c’est souvent une arme négligée.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Star Eyes.name: Star Eyes
Star Eyes.description:
All edeinos can see in the dark to some extent, but some are born with additional guanine crystals in their eyes that refract and amplify ambient light. Those born with stars in their eyes, as the jakatts say, can ignore four points of vision penalties due to darkness.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Stim Shot.name: Stim Shot
Stim Shot.description: A Tech 23 hypodermic that delivers a blast of adrenalin and stimulants to get a Storm Knight back on her feet. It requires a simple action and a Very Easy (DN 6) first aid test to apply the shot. Once applied the Storm Knight recovers [[/r 1d6x6max5]]{1BD} worth of Shock, and regains consciousness if KOed.

Stinger AA.name: Missile anti-aérien Stinger
Stinger AA.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#explosifs-&-attaques-a-effets-de-zone]{Zone d'effet}

Missile autoguidé conçu pour être utilisé contre les avions volant à basse altitude, le Stinger est doté d’un tube jetable qui peut être fixé sur un poste de tir et déployé par une seule personne.

Le tireur utilise une action pour Viser la cible et effectue un test d’Armes lourdes. Un succès Standard permet de verrouiller la cible et le missile peut être tiré avec une autre action. Un succès Supérieur octroie un bonus de +2 au moment où le missile est tiré et un succès Spectaculaire permet de bénéficier d’un bonus de +4. Un tireur peut continuer à viser sa cible en espérant obtenir le bonus de +4 à son test d’Armes lourdes quand il décidera de faire feu.

Le pilote de l’appareil ciblé peut effectuer un test de Défense active pour éviter le missile et il ajoute +4 à son jet s’il bénéficie de contre-mesures anti-missiles telles qu’un brouilleur ou des paillettes.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Stone Skin.name: Stone Skin
Stone Skin.description:
Perhaps the edeinos and the creatures Earthlings call dinosaurs share some common ancestors, for some of their species seem to bear the monstrous lizards’ traits.

Edeinos with Stone Skin are evidence of such a link. Their scales are tinged with gray—though some cover or color them with natural materials to hide it—and are much tougher than most others of their kind.

The Stone Skin Perk grants an edeinos Armor +2. This is normal Armor, and therefore does not stack with other forms of @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#armor]{Armor}.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Storm Caller.name: Storm Caller
Storm Caller.description:
The Storm Knight can engage another reality-rated character in a reality storm. See @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.0dDSfvtyUrMthBzv#invoked-storms]{Invoked Storms} for a complete description.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Storm Caller.prerequisites: At least three other Reality Perks

Storyteller.name: Storyteller
Storyteller.description:
After a Glory card is played, the zone fills with ambient Possibility Energy. A Storm Knight with the Storyteller Perk can spread the tale of the deed and directly utilize that Possibility Energy.

Telling the tale requires an audience, a performance of the teller’s choosing (narration, a song, etc.), and a persuasion test vs the standard zone modifiers (−4 in a Dominant Zone and –8 in a Pure Zone).

Tales may be told once per act, and only in a zone where the Storyteller took part in playing a Glory card within the last month. The performer doesn’t have to have played the card himself, he just has to have been present at the event.

The Storyteller gains a separate pool of @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.kYP18QiA72P6PlUi#possibilities]{Possibilities}, one on a standard success, two on a Good, and three on an Outstanding. For the rest of the act, the Storm Knight can spend these Possibilities for himself or for anyone who heard the tale (GM’s call)—including Ords! This is a free action.

Note that telling tales of the Storm Knights’ deeds almost always attracts attention from the High Lords and their minions. All the Reality Raiders are quick to hunt down such thorns in their sides.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Strangle.name: Strangle
Strangle.description:
Invisible but deadly, strangle is a frightening technique where a telekinetic squeezes blood vessels or organs inside a foe.

Victims of the attack suffer 2 Shock.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Strangle.outstanding: The attack causes 4 Shock and the target is Stymied

Strike.name: Strike
Strike.description:
Sometimes even the most peaceful of the chosen must pick up the staff. This powerful miracle makes sure that staff packs a punch. Strike affects a single melee or missile weapon, no Multi-Targeting is allowed.

Strike increases the damage value of a weapon by +1. It doesn’t matter if the weapon is ranged or designed for melee—its base damage is still increased. Strike must be cast on a weapon, not ammunition.

A weapon blessed with strike counts as magical for purposes of affecting foes with the Ethereal or similar abilities that generally ignore normal weapons.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Strong-willed.name: Strong-willed
Strong-willed.description:
The character can always use Spirit when testing for Defeat, regardless of her Strength.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Stun.name: Stun
Stun.description:
A wave of arcane energy overwhelms a group of foes. It affects everyone within a Large @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#explosives-and-area-effect-attacks]{Zone d'effet} area. This is an Area Affect spell and may not Multi-Target.

Any target affected becomes Very Stymied. Stun only works on living beings, so undead, constructs, or animated objects are unaffected.

Présent dans Core Rules
Stun.good: Affected targets may not move on their next turn
Stun.outstanding: Affected targets lose their entire next turn

Super Attribute.name: Super Attribute
Super Attribute.description:
Super Attribute allows a pulp hero to exceed normal maximums of Charisma, Dexterity, Mind, Spirit, or Strength. She is a paragon of one of these virtues with few rivals in the Nile Empire.

When taken, Super Attribute increases a selected attribute by +1.

The Nile Empire is a pulp realm—not a world of four-color superheroes — so Super Attribute may only be taken once (not once per attribute). Choose wisely!

Super Attribute increases the attribute limit a like amount.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Super Skill.name: Super Skill
Super Skill.description:
The pulp hero is exceptionally good at something. Maybe he’s a crack shot in fire combat, a mind unrivaled in science, or has a wit that cuts his foes to the bone via taunt.

When Super Skill is taken, the character increases any one skill by two adds. She may exceed the usual maximum of +5 adds without taking the Mastery Perk. (If the character has the Mastery Perk, it stacks with Super Skill.) This stacks with all other skill increases and allows a pulp hero to reach superhuman levels of competency far faster than most.

Like Super Attribute, the champion may only take this Perk once — she cannot have more than one Super Skill.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Super Skill.prerequisites: At least three adds in the selected skill

Supernatural Adaption.name: Supernatural Adaption
Supernatural Adaption.description: Exposure to other realities allows the Storm Knight to expand the scope of their own abilities and learn spells that are foreign to their own training. The hero gains access to a single new spell list and may replace up to two spells, miracles, or psionic powers they currently know with new spells from that list. This access does not count as a Prereq for the selection of other Perks that require access to that spell list.
Supernatural Adaption.prerequisites: Beta Clearance, access to any spell list, and @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.ADQgF3E47pmCCHys]{Realm Runner} OR Gamma Clearance and access to any spell list.

Survivor.name: Survivor
Survivor.description:
Whether she’s blessed by fate, destined for some greater end, or just tough as nails, this Storm Knight is hard to kill. She ignores all wound penalties when testing for @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#defeat]{Defeat}.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description:
Swarms are composed of hordes of smaller, individual creatures. Eliminating one, or even dozens has no real effect on the swarm as a whole. Unarmed and crushing weapons deal base damage normally. Area attacks deal damage normally. Blades, bullets, or weapons that can’t hit dozens of creatures at once deal no damage at all.

Each round, any character in contact with the swarm on its turn suffers two Shock. Large swarms have +5 Shock and +2 Wounds.

TOW Anti-Tank.name: Missile anti-char TOW
TOW Anti-Tank.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#explosifs-&-attaques-a-effets-de-zone]{Zone d'effet}

Tiré à partir d’un emplacement d’arme sur un véhicule, comme une jeep ou un hélicoptère, le TOW est un missile filoguidé que le tireur dirige vers sa cible. Il faut verrouiller la cible, aussi le tireur doit @Compendium[te001-core-rulebook.regles.Elk2ungvWnuygrfq]{Viser} avant d’attaquer. Le coût initial correspond au lanceur et à ses systèmes puis il faut acheter chaque missile séparément.

Tactical Armor.name: Armure tactique
Tactical Armor.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#fatigue-:]{Fatigue}

Tenue de protection moderne de catégorie militaire avec plusieurs couches, un casque et qui couvre toutes les parties du corps tout en offrant une bonne mobilité.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Tap Ley Line.name: Tap Ley Line
Tap Ley Line.description:
The wizard can tap into the arcane energy of nearby ley lines to temporarily enhance his Magic Axiom and reduce the likelihood of disconnecting when casting contradictory spells. If the caster is in a reality other than Core Earth, the Zone modifiers apply (-4 for Dominant, -8 for Pure). On a success, the wizard’s Magic Axiom temporarily increases to 12.

If the wizard is in another cosm entirely, this ability may not be used. This spell may be cast only once per scene.
Tap Ley Line.good: The wizard's Magic Axiom increases to 15.
Tap Ley Line.outstanding: The wizard's Magic Axiom increases to 18.

Targeting Scope.name: Targeting Scope
Targeting Scope.description:
Targeting scopes are lowpowered telescopes that let the firer see distant targets better. When combined with the Aim option the character ignores the first two points of Range penalties for an attack.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Taser.name: Taser
Taser.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#douleur-:]{Douleur}

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#desequilibre]{Déséquilibre}

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#dommages-non-letaux]{Dommages non létaux}

Un petit mécanisme à ressort qui projette des électrodes sur une cible, généralement grâce à un système à air comprimé. L’arme a une portée courte mais libère un puissant choc électrique sur sa cible. Un taser inflige des points de Choc normalement mais aucune Blessure. Une cible touchée subit automatiquement un résultat Très déstabilisé à cause de spasmes musculaires incontrôlables.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Technodemon Hide Vest.name: Veste en cuir de Technodémon
Technodemon Hide Vest.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#fatigue-:]{Fatigue}

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#integrale/torse-:]{Torse}

Tuer un démon et lui arracher sa peau est difficile. Trouver des produits chimiques assez puissants pour traiter et tanner la peau est encore plus dur. Mais le résultat en vaut la peine : une armure légère, souple et extrêmement résistante. L’effet de Fatigue ne vient pas du poids de l’armure mais de l’inconfort et des cauchemars générés par la peau qui est encore imprégnée de malfaisance.

Aussi Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook Module

Telekinesis.name: Telekinesis
Telekinesis.description:
Telekinesis allows a psi to move objects with her mind. The psi’s Spirit is her Strength once activated, but she continues to use her own skills as usual. If she wishes to grab a creature, she must use the Grappling rules as normal.

A psi can move up to two objects at one time (including herself to fly). She must be able to lift the combined weight of the objects, and they move up to her walking speed. In Good and Outstanding results replace Mind with Spirit.

 

Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook, Core Rules
Telekinesis.good: Range of 50 meters and add +2 to the power’s effective Strength
Telekinesis.outstanding: Range of 50 meters and add +4 to the power’s effective Strength

Telekinetic Anomaly.name: Telekinetic Anomaly
Telekinetic Anomaly.description:
The psi gains access to the @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.zRmNjKY2Ge8KbXG3.JournalEntryPage.cApN1RD5J17QCDZ3#telekinetic-anomaly]{Telekinetic Anomaly} list and may learn three powers, even if she does not have the requisite kinesis skill. She is subject to the effects listed in the @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.zRmNjKY2Ge8KbXG3.JournalEntryPage.cApN1RD5J17QCDZ3#wild-talents]{Wild Talents} sidebar.

Special: The psi may never gain adds in precognition or telepathy, nor learn any psionic powers requiring those skills.

Additional Powers: The psi may take the Psionic Perk, but only gains additional powers, not the access to a new power list.

 

Présent dans Core Earth Psionics
Telekinetic Anomaly.prerequisites: At least one add in kinesis. May not have any adds in telepathy or precognition, and may not know any psionic powers that require telepathy or precognition

Telekinetic Barrier.name: Telekinetic Barrier
Telekinetic Barrier.description:
The psionicist wards off incoming attacks with a barrier of raw telekinetic energy.

Successful activation adds +1 to all the caster’s defenses (dodge, melee combat, and unarmed combat). The bonus follows normal Stacking rules, so a character with an actual shield inside a telekinetic barrier benefits only from whichever is highest.

@UUID[Compendium.torgeternity.macros.Macro.sZsA7sBGVaCJTzz0]{Buff!}

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Telepathic Anomaly.name: Telepathic Anomaly
Telepathic Anomaly.description:
The psi gains access to the @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.zRmNjKY2Ge8KbXG3.JournalEntryPage.cApN1RD5J17QCDZ3#telepathic-anomaly]{Telepathic Anomaly} list and may learn three powers, even if she does not have the requisite telepathy skill. She is subject to the effects listed in the @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.zRmNjKY2Ge8KbXG3.JournalEntryPage.cApN1RD5J17QCDZ3#wild-talents]{Wild Talents} sidebar.

Special: The psi may never gain adds in precognition or telepathy, nor learn any psionic powers requiring those skills.

Additional Powers: The psi may take the Psionic Perk, but only gains additional powers, not the access to a new power list.

 

Présent dans Core Earth Psionics
Telepathic Anomaly.prerequisites: At least one add in kinesis. May not have any adds in telepathy or precognition, and may not know any psionic powers that require telepathy or precognition

Telepathy.name: Telepathy
Telepathy.description:
Sending and receiving thoughts is considered the most basic power of any officially trained psi, such as those who work for Core Earth’s government agencies.

A Standard success allows the psi to keep up to four other minds in contact as long as she continues to concentrate. It may not use the Multi-Target option.

The psi must be able to see those she wants to contact if they are unfamiliar to her.

Unconscious characters cannot be reached.

If the target is unwilling to be contacted via telepathy, the DN is his willpower or Mind instead. Even if communication is established with an unwilling target, it doesn’t allow the psi to read thoughts, only to communicate and hear thoughts intentionally projected by the target.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Telepathy.good: The psi can connect up to 10 minds (including her own)
Telepathy.outstanding: The psi can connect up to 20 minds (including her own)

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description:
With this power, the psi may transport herself, her belongings and any small objects she holds (but not other beings) directly to another location within range. She can declare the target location either generally (e.g. to the other side of the door) or by direction and distance (e.g. 10 meters straight up).

On a success, the psi teleports successfully but is disoriented upon arrival and is Stymied and Vulnerable.

The psi may teleport to locations she cannot see, but the kinesis test takes a Hard (–4) penalty. If she would accidentally appear in a solid she teleports to the nearest safe location (within range, which may include her origin point) but all tests are Disfavored until the end of her next turn.
Teleport.good: The psi is not Stymied or Vulnerable after teleporting.
Teleport.outstanding: As Good and the psi’s next attack against enemies in the vicinity are Favored.

Tenacious.name: Tenacious
Tenacious.description:
Nothing seems to keep the hero down for long. Her tests to Soak damage become Favored.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Thav Integrated Weapon Mount.name: Thav Integrated Weapon Mount
Thav Integrated Weapon Mount.description:
One of the character’s limbs is rebuilt with any Thav manufactured weapon or firearm built in. The mechanism is obvious, but modular so the weapon may be changed as desired. Any attached weapons are purchased separately.

 

Also Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook Module.
Thav Integrated Weapon Mount.notes: Plus the cost of the weapon (any Thav)

Thav Radiation Filter MK II.name: Thav Radiation Filter MK II
Thav Radiation Filter MK II.description:
Wounds from radiation heal normally.

 

Also Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook Module.

Thav-9 SMG.name: Thav-9 SMG
Thav-9 SMG.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#short-burst]{Rafale Courte}

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#tirer-sur-des-cibles-en-melee]{Pistolet}

Un pistolet-mitrailleur standard utilisé à Tharkold. Un frein de bouche sophistiqué empêche les problèmes liés aux tirs en rafales courtes.

The Chalice of Elfkind.name: The Chalice of Elfkind
The Chalice of Elfkind.description:
Purpose: To aid the Elves in times of need.

Description: According to legend the Chalice of Elfkind was forged in ancient times by the first Queen of the elves, and given to the dwarves as a gift of peace. It’s been exchanged countless times, and now both races are convinced it is the other who remains in possession of this artifact. It appears like a short silver goblet, ringed with sapphire and ruby gems and covered in exquisite elven etchings.

Powers: Water or other liquid poured into the chalice takes on magical energy if the pourer succeeds in tapping into the shard. When drunk from the chalice, the affected liquid eliminates a disease, cures a curse, or heals up to three current Wounds and restores all Shock. The chalice must be refilled (and tapped) before it may be used again.

Restrictions: The Chalice’s Possibilities may not be used except to activate its powers as above.

The Deathhead Knob.name: The Deathhead Knob
The Deathhead Knob.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.handouts.JournalEntry.HOHkktsYs6RCt2HP.JournalEntryPage.Ex0thIo6jXHoyIvS]{Handout}

Purpose: To keep moving.

Description: The Deathhead Knob appears as a chrome skull just smaller than a fist, with sharp fangs and a wide grin. Inside its deep eye sockets are two eerily glowing gems, one red, the other blue. Whatever its original, sinister purpose, now it’s usually affixed to automobile gear shifts. Vehicles left in one place too long after the knob is installed tend to mysteriously disappear.

Powers: When installed in a vehicle of any type that vehicle’s @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#maneuver-rating-(mr)]{Maneuverability Rating} increases by two. Note that may make the rating a positive number. The driver may test to tap the shard to attempt to Soak damage to the vehicle.

Restrictions: The knob’s Possibilities may only be used to enhance vehicle skill tests and to Soak Wounds to the vehicle as described above in Powers.

The Heart of Coyote.name: The Heart of Coyote
The Heart of Coyote.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.handouts.JournalEntry.HOHkktsYs6RCt2HP.JournalEntryPage.Dhrt651rHMbAJxCK]{Handout}

Purpose: To awaken spiritual power within humanity.

Description: The Heart of Coyote is a turquoise stone with crimson bands swirling through it, shaped like a human heart and about the same size. Coyote was a hero of American Indian legends who helped mankind by bringing (some say stealing) things from the gods. When Coyote was preparing to leave man on his own, he left a piece of himself behind in case man ever needed his help again.

Powers: Beings in contact with the Heart of Coyote are in a Dominant Zone of Core Earth reality.

Restrictions: The heart’s Possibilities may only be used to augment Spirit or Spirit-based skills.

The Maleficex.name: The Maleficex
The Maleficex.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.handouts.JournalEntry.HOHkktsYs6RCt2HP.JournalEntryPage.FEhyLRzNUOeUANCl]{Handout}

Purpose: To spread knowledge of dark magic.

Description: This large tome is bound in decaying leather and embossed with mysterious symbols. The cover of the book features a small, strange skull with red gemstones in its eye sockets and a blue gem in its mouth.

Powers: Holding or reading from the Maleficex raises the caster’s Magic Axiom to a minimum of 16, even in a Pure Zone that wouldn’t otherwise support such arcane energy. If a sentient being is sacrificed before the book its Tapping Difficulty drops down to 10 for one hour.

Restrictions: The Possibilities within the Maleficex may only be used to enhance tests for magic skills.

The Oni Blades.name: The Oni Blades
The Oni Blades.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.handouts.JournalEntry.HOHkktsYs6RCt2HP.JournalEntryPage.zfi4gkfMRIC8sk70]{Handout}

Purpose: To strike down the wielder’s foes.

Description: The @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.wn5ItclGLlUF2zgA]{Oni Blades} are a matching pair of katanas (Damage: Strength +4, Armor Piercing 2.) One has red etchings of demons in the blade, and a hilt wrapped in red silk, while the other’s etchings and grip are blue.

Powers: A character armed with either blade gains +3 Toughness against any melee weapon attack, or +5 Toughness when armed with both. Unarmed and ranged attacks aren’t affected. The wielder may spend a Possibility to reroll the katana’s bonus dice. Always take the new result.

Restrictions: The blades’ Possibilities may only be spent to augment melee weapons skill tests or to reroll bonus damage with either katana. If the blades are wielded against one another by two opponents no powers may be used and the Tapping Difficulty increases to 30.

The Penance Configuration.name: The Penance Configuration
The Penance Configuration.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.handouts.JournalEntry.HOHkktsYs6RCt2HP.JournalEntryPage.d9dMOkfd7XongwKx]{Handout}

Purpose: To discover and publicize secrets.

Description: Urban legend suggests that the Penance Configuration was created by a secret order of monks hoping to penetrate the GodNet and communicate directly with God. The chip itself is small, cross-shaped, and blue, with faintly glowing red circuits. Most computers and cyberdecks require modification before the chip can be installed.

Powers: Any device with the Penance Configuration chip installed is immune to the GodNet’s influence. Anyone carrying or using the device counts as being within a Cyberpapacy Dominant Zone.

Restrictions: The chip’s Possibilities may be used to enhance any Mind or Mind-based skills.

Thompson 1928.name: Thompson 1928
Thompson 1928.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#rafale-longue]{Rafale Longue}

Le fameux "Tommy gun" a été rendu célèbre par son utilisation par les gangsters au cours des la prohibition aux États-Unis. Arme lourde, la Thomson tire des munitions de calibre .45 et elle est redoutable à courte portée grâce à sa cadence de tir élevée. Il peut utiliser des chargeurs de 20 balles mais il plus connu pour son chargeur tambour, ou camembert, de 50 coups. Les munitions sont données aussi bien pour un chargeur classique que pour le chargeur tambour. La Thompson ne peut pas s’utiliser au coup par coup, uniquement en mode Rafale courte ou longue.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Throwing Axe.name: Hache de jet
Throwing Axe.description:
Un tomahawk ou d’autres haches légères prévues pour être lancées. Également utilisables comme arme de mêlée avec le même bonus.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Thunder Brew.name: Thunder Brew
Thunder Brew.description:
From @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.XEGw7i8Qw7GfFkFp]{Alchemy} Perk

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#explosives-and-area-effect-attacks]{Zone d'effet}

This explosive brew is placed inside a glass container and used as a grenade. It detonates on impact, potentially concussing anyone in a Medium Zone d'effet. Those affected must make a standard Strength test. Those who pass suffer 2 shock; those who fail are KO’ed.

Tiger's Eye Crystal.name: Tiger's Eye Crystal
Tiger's Eye Crystal.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te008-aysle.aysle-journals.PQRWfK8bsqZ10lY1.JournalEntryPage.wIrHC8wmJX9fGfdm#enchanted-and-arcane-items]{Enchanted}

A Tiger's Eye is a stone made of quartz striped with various shades of golden brown. It is known for it's protective properties and grants +1 Full Body Armor.

Tracer Patch.name: Tracer Patch
Tracer Patch.description:
A small swath of fabric that clings to anything it is placed against, and alters its color and texture to become visually undetectable. Any attuned device can locate the patch so long as it’s within wireless broadcast range.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Tracers Rechargements.name: Tracers Rechargements
Tracers Rechargements.description:
Only for @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#heavy-weapons-and-explosives]{Heavy Weapons}

Using phosphorus or similar pyrotechnics, one in five rounds fired burns brightly enough to be visible during daylight, allowing the firer to see the actual trajectory the projectiles follow so corrections can be made. Tracers only have an effect when fired @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#rafale-longue]{Rafale Longue}. After firing, the tracers grant the firer an @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#aim]{Aim} for their next shot. Tracers appear at Tech 19.

Tracking Device.name: Tracking Device
Tracking Device.description:
A beacon that broadcasts its location to any attuned radio receiver within one kilometer.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Trademark Weapon.name: Arme de prédilection
Trademark Weapon.description:
Le Chevalier des tempêtes est particulièrement doué avec une arme donnée. Quand il bénéficie de dés bonus aux dommages avec cette arme, le joueur peut relancer les 1 et accepter le nouveau résultat.

S’il perd son arme, le MJ doit lui permettre de la remplacer, généralement au début du prochain Acte.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Trash Talker.name: Trash Talker
Trash Talker.description: When Taunt is an Approved Action, the MultiTarget penalties for taunt interaction attacks are halved (–1 per additional target instead of the usual –2.)
Trash Talker.prerequisites: Beta Clearance, at least five adds in taunt

Travel Ley Line.name: Travel Ley Line
Travel Ley Line.description:
This ability allows the geomancer and up to 8 allies to instantly transport from one ley node to another. The departure node can be any of the ones on Core Earth, but the arrival node must be one that is Magic 15 or higher. The nodes much be in a Core Earth Dominant or Pure Zone, but can include hardpoints (by traveling through the interior of the Earth). Even if a reality such as Aysle has a Magic Axiom higher than 15, it does not properly maintain the ley line structure needed for this spell to work.

To activate the ley node, the mage creates a circle with chalk, sand, or other materials, around the people who will be traveling the ley lines. As long as the circle isn’t broken when the casting time is complete, the travelers instantly teleport to the desired ley node.

Under most circumstances, this casting can be done without effort, and no test is necessary. However, if the geomancer is activating the node under time pressure (such as during combat), this ability is activated through a Dramatic Skill Resolution, with all four Steps requiring a successful Hard (DN 14) apportation test.

The use of this ability requires Magic 15, so any tests involved in activating the ley node could be contradictory.
Travel Ley Line.prerequisites: @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.AYDnaeXs0T3fstx9]{Geomancer} and at least 5 adds in apportation.

Trigon Body Plating.name: Trigon Body Plating
Trigon Body Plating.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#integrale/torse-:]{Intégrale/Torse}

This subdermal armor is grafted throughout the patient’s body, increasing overall durability. It adds +2 Armor, and provides Full Body coverage. Note that body plating is armor, so it doesn’t stack with any worn armor - just take the highest value for a location.

 

Also Présent dans Cyberpapacy Sourcebook Module
Trigon Body Plating.notes: +2 Armor, Full Body, concealed under skin

Trigon Integrated Weapon Mount.name: Trigon Integrated Weapon Mount
Trigon Integrated Weapon Mount.description:
One of the character’s limbs is rebuilt with any melee weapon or firearm built in. The mechanism is concealed with lifelike NeuraSkin, so long as the weapon is smaller than the limb. Add the cost of the weapon to the cost of the implant to determine the final value. Note that tools such as lock picks may be installed in such mounts as well.

@UUID[Compendium.te010-cyberpapacy.cyberpapacy-items.Item.te6AAa0je4oyCBZB]{Updated version} Présent dans Cyberpapacy Sourcebook Module
Trigon Integrated Weapon Mount.notes: Concealed, add the cost of the weapon

Truncheon.name: Matraque
Truncheon.description:
Une matraque constituée de matériaux modernes et parfaitement équilibrée. De nombreuses versions ont une extrémité mobile ou sont pliables.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Undead.name: Undead
Undead.description:
This loathsome thing is some sort of animated corpse. It may be a vampire, a zombie, a gospog, or some other vile horror. Undead are never affected by powers, spells, or abilities that affect breathing, eating, Fatigue, or other functions required only by the living. Such creatures always count as @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.Pu4XsglS98BqDRgX#supernatural-evil]{Supernatural Evil}
 when determining the effects that Perks or powers have upon them.

Unflinching.name: Unflinching
Unflinching.description:
A true samurai puts her mission first, even above her own personal safety. She pushes her body to the limits of its endurance to accomplish her goals.

An Unflinching samurai may eliminate one or more levels of Stymied or Vulnerable by taking one shock per condition removed. For one shock, for example, she could reduce Very Stymied to Stymied. For two shock, she could eliminate both, or negate a Stymied and Vulnerable condition, and so on.

@UUID[Compendium.te016-pan-pacifica.pan-pacifica-items.Item.V2wPq6DxZfQY4al2]{Updated Version} Présent dans Pan-Pacifica Sourcebook Module.

Updraft.name: Updraft
Updraft.description:
The hero create gusts of air that lifts her a regular move straight up. Next turn she drifts back down along any path you desire as your walk move.

 

Présent dans Core Earth Psionics
Updraft.good: The psi moves in the air without descending for an extra turn
Updraft.outstanding: The psi moves in the air without descending for two extra turns

Usaanta.name: Usaanta
Usaanta.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.handouts.JournalEntry.HOHkktsYs6RCt2HP.JournalEntryPage.lAFjXf9XQH1U8ibr]{Handout}

Purpose: To help life flourish in precarious places.

Description: This unique and legendary gem looks like a flower, and may be Présent dans higher elevations of the Living Land “growing“ out of a difficult to reach cliff face. The petals are actually crystal, colored red with a blue center. If the bearer of Usaanta is killed or exhausts its Possibilities the petals disintegrate (seemingly destroying the shard) and a new “flower“ begins to grow elsewhere.

Powers: When carried, the Usaanta increases the bearer’s Wound limit by one.

Restrictions: The Possibilities of the shard may not be used on attacks.

Uzi.name: UZI
Uzi.description:
@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#short-burst]{Rafale Courte}

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#tirer-sur-des-cibles-en-melee]{Pistolet}

Célèbre à cause des nombreux films dans lesquels il apparaît, l'Uzi est répandu dans le monde entier. C’est une arme très résistante conçue pour une utilisation intensive.

Vanquisher’s Blade.name: Vanquisher’s Blade
Vanquisher’s Blade.description:
A polished steel sword that repels creatures of supernatural evil. Any hit against such a foe also makes it Very Vulnerable.

 

@UUID[Compendium.te008-aysle.aysle-items.Item.te6GwwX5EOOURglz]{Updated version} Présent dans Aysle Sourcebook Module

Vav Sensation Suppressor.name: Vav Sensation Suppressor
Vav Sensation Suppressor.description:
The subject’s pleasure and pain receptors are shunted or rerouted. The result is a constant unpleasant numbness. Reduce the shock a character suffers from any source by one, whether from damage, failure to activate powers or spells, or other sources. Subjects with this implant tend to become addicted to extreme sensations that can overwhelm the suppressor.

 

Also Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook Module.

Vav Toxin Suppressor.name: Vav Toxin Suppressor
Vav Toxin Suppressor.description:
Filters throughout the subject’s blood vessels work to screen any identified poisons. The cyborg tests Strength to recover from the effects of poison every three rounds, rather than once a minute.

 

Also Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook Module.
Vav Toxin Suppressor.notes: Test to eliminate poison after 3 rounds

Vengeful.name: Vengeful
Vengeful.description:
Revenge isn’t always a bad thing. When a Vengeful character suffers a wound, she gets an Up result on the next action taken against the offender in the same scene. This doesn’t stack with other Up results. The wound must actually be sustained, not taken and then Soaked, for example.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Vow of Nonviolence.name: Vow of Nonviolence
Vow of Nonviolence.description:
The faithful takes a vow of nonviolence, but not one of true pacifism. After an oppnent rolls a bonus for an attack, the Storm Knight may spend a Possibility to roll another bonus and take the lowest. If the attacker spent any Possiblities, the hero must spend an equal amount of additional Possibilities. However, any test to make a physical attack suffers a -2 penalty.

Making an attack that can cause Shock or Wounds against a target who has not made a physical attack against the hero, an ally, or an innocent bystander in the current scene is a major violation of this vow and the character loses the use of this Perk for the remainder of the act.

Also Présent dans Pan-Pacifica Sourcebook Module
Vow of Nonviolence.prerequisites: At least one add in faith

Walk on water.name: Walk on water
Walk on water.description:
Walk on water allows affected targets to move their normal speed (not run) atop liquids as if the surface were solid ground. A submerged target may climb up and out of the water, and those on the surface may dive

underwater if they choose. The invoker may attempt to affect multiple people by taking the usual @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#multi-targeting]{Multi-Targeting} penalties.
Walk on water.outstanding: Affected targets may run atop liquid surfaces as well

Wall Crawlers.name: Wall Crawlers
Wall Crawlers.description:
The fibers of these boots and gloves temporarily bond with materials they are pressed against. Even slick surfaces like smooth glass become DN 10 to scale.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Wall of Stone.name: Wall of Stone
Wall of Stone.description: The geomancer lifts the rock, stone, and earth to form a wall up to 10 meters long, 3 meters high, and 30 centimeters thick at a place within range. The wall repels all attempts to penetrate it until it is dismissed or breached. It has Toughness 15, is immune to Shock damage, and can take 1 Wound.
Wall of Stone.outstanding: As Good and the wall's Wound limit increases to two.

War Boomerang.name: Boomerang de combat
War Boomerang.description:
Ces lourds boomerangs peuvent être lancés de manière à ce qu’ils décrivent une courbe dans les airs. Si l’attaque est ratée, l’arme revient jusqu’à celui qui l’a lancé sauf s’il obtient un échec critique.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Ward Enemy.name: Ward Enemy
Ward Enemy.description:
Ward enemy protects the faithful from supernatural beings that prey on or seek to harm humanity.

To cast, the invoker must brandish a holy symbol, recite prayers, or otherwise clearly call on the source of his power, making him an obvious target for the taunts of spirits, demons, or other antagonists likely to be affected.

While the ward is active, all allies within five meters add +1 to their defenses versus @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.Pu4XsglS98BqDRgX#supernatural-evil]{supernaturally evil} creatures and their attacks. The bonus counts toward both physical and interaction defenses.

Special: This miracle may be attempted without the Miracles Perk if the faith prerequisite is met.

In the Cyberpapacy faith, witches and other spellcasters are considered supernatural enemies of the faith. In addition to supernaturally evil creatures, the ward enemy miracle invoked by a worshiper of the Cyberpapacy functions against any character with any Spellcaster Perk or spellcasting Special Ability.

 

Présent dans Core Rules
Ward Enemy.good: Those protected add +2 to all defenses
Ward Enemy.outstanding: As the Good result, and supernaturally evil creatures who fail an attack against any of the protected individuals are Stymied

Warden.name: Warden
Warden.description:
Elven wardens roamed the wilderness of Aysle before Uthorion’s Rage, always alert for threats to the good folk. After the Dark One’s hordes marched through their forests, the wardens’ numbers went from thousands to less than a hundred.

Strangely, most of those survivors came to Earth. They are tight-lipped as to why, but seem to bear some secret shame over their people’s inability to stop the High Lord before his attention shifted to Core Earth.

Wardens are independent, stealthy, and cunning, and many are accompanied by animals they have befriended in the wild (see @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.j1cM05PejztjGAjk]{White Wolf}).

Wardens treat stealth and tracking as Favored skills.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Wealthy.name: Wealthy
Wealthy.description: Some people are born into riches and prosperity, while others earn it the hard way. The character has $10 000 worth of starting gear instead of the usual $1 000, and persuasion or streetwise is Favored when testing to purchase an item or service.

Whip Tail.name: Whip Tail
Whip Tail.description:
The lizard-folk use their tails primarily for balance, but some have learned to fight with them as well, performing complicated spins and flips that turn their tails into long, whip-like weapons. Unarmed combat becomes Favored.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Whirlwind.name: Whirlwind
Whirlwind.description:
The warrior has trained to hit a large number of foes in a single dance of death. He ignores the first two points of the @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.EhKa65cpHvodUl2L#multi-targeting]{Multi-Targeting} penalty when using melee weapons or unarmed combat.

Also Présent dans Pan-Pacifica Sourcebook Module.

White Wolf.name: White Wolf
White Wolf.description:
Elven wardens often take white wolves as companions (not pets), and the two live, fight, and die together from the moment of bonding on.

This Perk grants an elven warden a loyal white wolf who follows basic commands and fights to the death to defend his master. The animal is as smart as the most well-trained dog of Core Earth, meaning it can select targets intelligently, defend a particular person or location, or retrieve an object if it’s seen it before. The owner can also designate rally spots the wolf can go to or wait, though this must be done ahead of time with a hand signal or command at the particular location. This is useful for those times a warden must go into a city or place the wolf might be unwelcome or endangered.

In game terms, the player should control the wolf most of the time, choosing his targets, rolling his attacks, and so forth.

White wolves do not have @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.kYP18QiA72P6PlUi#possibilities]{Possibilities}, but the warden can spend his Possibilities (and Destiny cards) for the creature—even if they are separated.

When a white wolf is slain, its spirit goes into a shadowy nether realm, gathering power and form until it can return to the land of the living at the beginning of the next act.

If the wolf’s master falls, it permanently loses a point of shock every 24 hours until it fades away to the spirit world, never to return.

@UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Actors.fImZbwzh0jbEYGN5]{White Wolf}

Présent dans Core Rules

Wiccan.name: Wiccan
Wiccan.description: The White Witches of the Cyberpapacy are spiritual cousins to those who follow the Wicca faith of Core Earth. Selecting this Perk counts as selecting the White Witch Perk (see Cyberpapacy Sourcebook) for all intents and purposes, including access to the White Witch spell list, access to any Perks that require White Witch as a Prereq, and any advantages or disadvantages such an association involves.
Wiccan.prerequisites: At least one add in faith, and at least one add in alteration, apportation, conjuration, or divination, and follower of @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.JournalEntry.uTwRLGOalhiSSWeA.JournalEntryPage.r4Txsus7j2Xabtw0#neopaganism]{Neopaganism}.

Wither.name: Wither
Wither.description:
This dark miracle drains the life force of any living thing it touches.

With a successful faith roll, the invocation causes 12 damage that ignores all physical armor. Wither works only on living things—it has no effect on objects, constructs, undead, etc.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Without a Trace.name: Without a Trace
Without a Trace.description:
Without a trace is a ward that enables the caster to remove clues in a location that either will reveal their identity, the victim of any crime perpetrated in the location, or how the crime was conducted. The location can be no larger than 10 meters square, or about the size of a typical school classroom. The spell must be cast from within the location.

On a success the spell alters the perception of any one viewing the location (even remotely) such that subtle clues can be missed or misinterpreted. This alteration of perception isn’t an illusion, but interference with the sensory and thought processes of the investigators. Divination, find, precognition, and evidence analysis tests conducted on the location or the subjects or objects within have a -4 penalty. Higher Success Levels impair investigations further.

Special: Without a trace may only be attempted once on an individual location.
Without a Trace.good: As Good but the duration increases to a year and a day.
Without a Trace.outstanding: As Good but find and evidence analysis tests are also Disfavored.

X-ray Charges.name: X-ray Charges
X-ray Charges.description:
A modulator for energy weapons that pushes the beam out of the visible spectrum. These special power packs are available starting at Tech 25. X-ray shots ignores the properties of Reflec and Diffrax armor.

Use @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.p3KGu4gN4iVDt6Ov]{X-ray Charges Rechargements}

 

Présent dans Core Rules

X-ray Charges Rechargements.name: X-ray Charges Rechargements
X-ray Charges Rechargements.description:
Aquired by @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.lurexaBcBx3fY4OA]{X-ray Charges}

A modulator for energy weapons that pushes the beam out of the visible spectrum. These special power packs are available starting at Tech 25. X-ray shots ignores the properties of Reflec and Diffrax armor.

Yin and Yang.name: Yin and Yang
Yin and Yang.description:
By invoking this miracle, the character taps into the belief that people, events, and things have complimentary aspects, and while bad luck may be ascendant, good luck may be just around the corner.

On a success, the hero’s luck flattens out. For the rest of the scene, if the character rolls a 1 at any time, including after spending a Possibility or in an Up condition, he immediately re-rolls the die. However, if the character rolls a 20 at any time, he immediately re-rolls as well.

This miracle may only be attempted once every scene.
Yin and Yang.good: The character immediately rerolls on a 1-2, as well as 20
Yin and Yang.outstanding: As Good, but the character rerolls on a 1-4, as well as 20

Zan Endoskeleton MK III.name: Zan Endoskeleton MK III
Zan Endoskeleton MK III.description:
A popular modification among thralls who prioritize efficiency over their humanity. Armor is grafted atop all the bones in the cyborg’s body, especially around the skull and ribcage. The cyborg’s skin appears normal, but any damage reveals the individual is as much robot as flesh now. The conversion adds +4 Armor and counts as @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.rules.pwneQ55M0nnDH0Us.JournalEntryPage.qKdamp4rrcX6TTt0#full-body/torso]{Full Body} protection.

 

Also Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook Module.
Zan Endoskeleton MK III.notes: +4 Armor, Full Body, concealed under skin

Zan Slashers.name: Zan Slashers
Zan Slashers.description:
Use @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.wg0fGkn4dioEnyfr]{Zan Slashers (Attack)}

Slashers are long blades housed in the forearms or fingers which extend when needed. The blades are sturdy and sharp, causing Strength +2 damage. Slashers use melee weapons for attacks.

  

Also Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook Module.

Zan Slashers (Attack).name: Zan Slashers (Attack)
Zan Slashers (Attack).description:
Attack for @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.ZX705tiVbANCEQyJ]{Zan Slashers}

Slashers are long blades housed in the forearms or fingers which extend when needed. The blades are sturdy and sharp, causing Strength +2 damage. Slashers use melee weapons for attacks.

 

Présent dans Core Rules

Zan Spinose Plating.name: Zan Spinose Plating
Zan Spinose Plating.description:
Use @UUID[Compendium.te001-core-rulebook.Items.Item.0tBeVYBIPdp6NfFd]{Zan Spinose Plating (Attack)}

An ugly dermal graft that adds protective plates to various parts of the cyborg’s body. Retractable spikes protrude from every plate, dealing Strength +1 damage. If grappled, the character may extend the spikes as a simple action and automatically break free. The plates offer Armor +2, but there are gaps. As usual, worn armor doesn’t stack; take the best value only.

 

Also Présent dans Tharkold Sourcebook Module.

Zan Spinose Plating (Attack).description:
